abstract: Wells Fargo said its earnings rose in part because it was more cautious with mortgage lending and less willing to engage in volatile Wall Street trading.
snippet: Wells Fargo said its earnings rose in part because it was more cautious with mortgage lending and less willing to engage in volatile Wall Street trading.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Within weeks of scooping up the failed banking operations of Washington Mutual in late 2008, JPMorgan Chase began phasing out the WaMu brand, replacing signs on retail branches. WaMu accounts became Chase accounts. Just over a year later, the conversion was done, turning the WaMu name into a relic of the financial crisis.

headline.main: Careful Approach Works for Wells Fargo, as Earnings Rise 7%
headline.print_headline: Careful Approach Works for Wells Fargo, as Earnings Rise 7%
